intro: Licania salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf licania, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its willow-like leaves that are elongated and often serrated. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming during the dry season. Its bark is fibrous and has been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes. Licania salicifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks.
